org.scec.data
Class DataPoint2D

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.scec.data.DataPoint2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class DataPoint2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

Title: DataPoint2D
Description: Represents a 2 dimensional point in function space. Each coordinate is represented by a Double.

The x value is the independent value, and the y value is the dependent value. Therefore this class is sorted on the x-value. Two DataPoint2D are equal if there x-values are equal, whatever the y value is. This will be useful in DiscretizedDFunctions.

Note: This class needs to be enhanced to use Number instead of Double. Then the values can be a Byte, Double, Float, Integer, Long, or Short, i.e. any suibclass of Number.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2001
Company:

See Also:
DiscretizedFunction2DAPI

equals

public boolean equals(DataPoint2D point)
Special equals function that returns true if the X Coordinates are the same, totally ignores the Y Value. This is useful because these points are used in Discretized functions, and need to sort on the X-Value, the independent value. Useful for sorting the functions then plotting them
Parameters:
point - Point to compare x-value to
Returns:
true if the two x-values are the same

equals

public boolean equals(DataPoint2D point,
                      java.lang.Double tolerance)
Same as equals(DataPoint2D) except that the X values only have to be close, within tolerance, to bec onsidered equal.
Parameters:
point - Point to compare x-value to
tolerance - The distance that the two x-values can be and still considered equal
Returns:
true if the two x-values are the same within tolerance

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object obj)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Compares two DataPoint2D objects and returns 0 if they have the same x coordinates, -1 if the first object has a smaller X Value, and +1 if it has a larger x value.
